description.para: The function allows users to test conformance to IEEE Standard 754-1985. Otherwise it's use is not recommended.
_logb(x) returns x's exponent n, a signed integer converted to double-precision floating-point. _logb(¡Àinfinity) = +infinity; _logb(0) = -infinity with a division by zero exception.

return.para: _logb returns the unbiased exponential value of x.

remarks.para: The _logb function extracts the exponential value of its double-precision floating-point argument x, as though x were represented with infinite range. If the argument x is denormalized, it is treated as if it were normalized.
